column2: MAINE DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. This road sign means:
2. A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:
3. This road sign means:
4. When passing a pedestrian who is walking on the road and an oncoming vehicle is approaching, you should:
column4: keep driving, you have the right-of-way.
column6: honk your horn to warn the pedestrian.
column8: slow down and let the vehicle pass first.

column2: 5. A crosswalk is:
column6: the area where pedestrians may cross the road.
column8: an area designated for blind persons.

column2: 6. Signs and markings requiring that you obey the indicated instruction are known as _____ signs.
7. Drivers should always be looking:
column4: directly in front of the car.
column6: beside, ahead and to the rear of the vehicle.

column2: 8. There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
column4: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.
column6: slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
column8: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.

column2: 9. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
10. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: go through as soon as the first train passes.
column6: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.
column8: proceed with caution until you see a train.
column10: go through when one of the tracks is free.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column6: A road joins from the right

column2: 12. This road sign means:
13. Drivers making a left turn at an intersection should yield the right-of-way to a bicyclist entering the intersection from the opposite direction.
14. When entering an interstate highway, you should check for a gap in traffic in the nearest lane, adjust your speed to match the flow of traffic, signal and:
column4: wait for the lane to be clear.
column6: merge into that gap when safe.

column2: 15. When you are angry or upset you should:
column4: have a few drinks before driving.
column6: take a few minutes to cool off before you drive.
column8: drive fast to let off steam.
column10: listen to loud music while driving.

column2: 16. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
column6: honk your horn and proceed with caution.
column8: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.

column2: 17. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column6: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.

column2: 18. Emergency vehicles:
column4: have the right-of-way when using siren and red/blue lights.
column6: may use a loudspeaker to give instructions.

column2: 19. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: show which lanes you must use.
column10: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.

column2: 20. Vehicles stopped behind a school bus when the red lights are flashing must remain stopped until:
column6: all students are off the bus.
column8: the stop arm is retracted and the bus begins moving.

column2: 21. Braking distance is how far a vehicle travels:
column8: before the driver hits the brakes.

column2: 22. Drivers who have been drinking are more likely to:
23. A yellow arrow used to control turns from a specific traffic lane:
column4: is warning the traffic a green arrow is about to be shown.
column6: is never used as a traffic signal.
column8: means that you may go in the direction indicated by the arrow.
column10: means the same as a circular yellow light for the lane of traffic indicated by the arrow.

column2: 24. Parking is not allowed:
column4: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column8: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column10: within 250 feet of a traffic light.

column2: 25. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 26. When entering an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: adjust speed to meet a traffic gap, then merge at a safe speed.
column6: check for cars and slow down to 25 MPH before merging with the flow of traffic.
column8: wait for an opening in traffic on the entrance ramp.
column10: come to a complete stop, check for cars and enter when safe to do so.

column2: 27. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column6: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 28. It is illegal to drive below the speed limit:
column10: when driving slowly disrupts the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 29. If one of your tires blows out while driving, you should:
column4: hold the steering wheel tightly and shift into neutral to bring the front of the vehicle back in line.
column6: apply the brakes firmly and steer toward the right edge of the road.
column10: hold the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and steer smoothly.

column2: 30. To prevent a fatigue-related crash while driving:
column4: find a safe parking area to take a 15 to 20 minute nap.
column6: drive at night when there are not as many vehicles on the roadway.
column8: continue driving so you will reach your destination sooner.

column2: 31. Reaction time is slower:
32. Motorcyclists are entitled to use the full width of a traffic lane; therefore, a driver should pass a motorcycle the same way as passing another vehicle.
33. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.
column8: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 34. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column8: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 35. At a crosswalk:
column4: construction workers must yield to drivers.

column2: 36. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column6: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.
column10: only if the traffic signal turns red.

column2: 37. When the road is slippery, drivers should _________ their following distance.
38. When you are facing a green light and there are pedestrians in the intersection:
column4: you have the right-of-way over pedestrians.
column6: you must signal your intention to cross the intersection at least 100 feet before yielding the right-of-way.
column8: you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.

column2: 39. When you are driving at night and another vehicle is approaching, you should use your parking lights.
40. Look over your shoulder to check your blind spot:
column4: when pulling to the right side of the road or away from a curb.
column8: on all right and left turns.

column2: 41. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.
column6: sound your horn and move to the left lane.
column8: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.
column10: try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.

column2: 42. To avoid traction loss from hydroplaning, drivers should:
column4: apply the brakes as soon as the car starts to skid.

column2: 43. This road sign means:
44. This road sign means:
column4: The roadway you are traveling on ends ahead
column8: A road joins from the left
column10: You must bear either right or left

column2: 45. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column6: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column8: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column10: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.

column2: 46. This sign means:
47. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column6: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column8: look both ways and be ready to stop.

column2: 48. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column6: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column8: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.
column10: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.

column2: 49. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column6: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.
column8: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.

column2: 50. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column6: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column8: Drivers should walk more and drive less.
column10: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.

column2: 51. This road sign means:
52. You are driving behind another vehicle and notice that the driver is driving with one hand, talking to a passenger. You as a driver:
column4: know that you should give the vehicle ahead extra room.
column6: know that the driver in the vehicle ahead is reducing his safety margin by being an inattentive driver.
column8: know that you should avoid this bad habit.

column2: 53. Smoking while driving:
54. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.
column10: from a one-way street into a one-way street.

column2: 55. A flashing yellow light means:
56. In bad weather conditions, when visibility is low, drivers should:
column4: speed up to get off the road quickly.
column6: drive in the lane closest to oncoming traffic.

column2: 57. When changing lanes, you should not:
column6: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots
column8: check your side and rear view mirrors.
column10: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

column2: 58. When you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light, you must:
column4: come to a complete stop, then proceed.

column2: 59. A bad car suspension can cause:
60. This road sign means:
column6: Watch for vehicles entering from the side
column8: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed
